definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: No junketing activity would be conducted on official expenses without permission of the company.
sentences.chinese: 在未得到公司授權情況下，不得以公費進行宴請活動。

sentences.english: Dining room is at ordinary times family dines jointly or the life space of repast of fete relatives and friends.
sentences.chinese: 餐室是平時家人共同進餐或宴請親友就餐的生活空間。

sentences.english: She'll be able to dine out on that story for days.
sentences.chinese: 那篇新聞報道能讓她在社交界今後幾天都受人宴請。

sentences.english: But sometimes because the schedule is tight, and there have been held a formal dinner at noon.
sentences.chinese: 但有時因日程安排較緊，也有在午間舉行正式宴請的。

sentences.english: I feasted my friends on my birthday .
sentences.chinese: 在我生日時，我宴請朋友們。

sentences.english: My mother wore a long dress because it was a formal meal.
sentences.chinese: 那是一次正式宴請，因此母親穿起了長禮服。

sentences.english: The restaurant especially attract Hong Kong person to have dining and it's fit to high-grade business invitation.
sentences.chinese: 餐廳很吸引香港人前來就餐，適合高檔的商務宴請。

sentences.english: Calculates daily cost of sales with regard to officer's checks and entertainment bills.
sentences.chinese: 就高職的工作餐及宴請單計算每日銷售成本。

sentences.english: Dining at banquet, always serve ladies first.
sentences.chinese: 宴請就餐時，應先給女士上菜。

sentences.english: He was feted by the Prime Minister, Gordon Brown, and given an honour guard of welcome on Horseguards Parade.
sentences.chinese: 他得到首相的宴請，並享受了皇家儀仗隊的歡迎。

sentences.english: During this time, Zhang Xiu feasted Cao Cao in Wancheng every day.
sentences.chinese: 一住數日，繡每日設宴請操。

sentences.english: During this time, the population feasted on the summer's bounty.
sentences.chinese: 在此期間，對夏季人口的宴請的恩惠。

sentences.english: On the evening of the same day, Prime Minister Roosevelt Skerrit hosted a banquet for the Chinese delegation.
sentences.chinese: 當日晚，斯凱里特總理宴請代表團一行。

sentences.english: The first state dinner in the Obama White House, hosting India.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬進駐白宮的第一場國宴宴請了印度首腦。

sentences.english: Son-in-law of the new home, her relatives and family room turns wine before dinner.
sentences.chinese: 新女婿上門後，孃家房族親戚輪番擺宴請酒。

sentences.english: Chinese and western pay attention to in the formal fete activity of ZuoCi arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 中西都講究正式的宴請活動的坐次安排。

definition: to get together all at once
to talk freely/to discuss without inhibition
to pay a visit/to call on
